properties.description: IONIX data connector with template version 3.0.0

connectorUiConfig.title: [DEPRECATED] IONIX Security Logs (Push)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
⚠️ **This connector is deprecated and will be removed in June 2026.** Please use the new 'IONIX Action Items (Polling)' connector instead, which provides automatic daily polling without requiring manual configuration in the IONIX portal.

---

The IONIX Security Logs data connector ingests logs from the IONIX system directly into Sentinel. The connector allows users to visualize their data, create alerts and incidents and improve security investigations.

sampleQueries.description: Fetch latest Action Items that are currently open
sampleQueries.query:
let lookbackTime = 14d;
CyberpionActionItems_CL
 | where TimeGenerated > ago(lookbackTime)
 | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by id_s
 | where is_open_b == true

dataTypes.name: CyberpionActionItems_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CyberpionActionItems_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CyberpionActionItems_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

customs.name: IONIX Subscription
customs.description: a subscription and account is required for IONIX logs. [One can be acquired here.](https://azuremarketplace.microsoft.com/en/marketplace/apps/cyberpion1597832716616.cyberpion)

instructionSteps.description: Follow the [instructions](https://www.ionix.io/integrations/azure-sentinel/) to integrate IONIX Security Alerts into Sentinel.

connectorUiConfig.title: IONIX Security Logs (via Codeless Connector Framework)
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown:
The IONIX connector allows you to ingest action items from your IONIX Attack Surface Management platform into Microsoft Sentinel using the Codeless Connector Framework (CCF). Action items represent security findings and vulnerabilities that require remediation.

**This connector automatically polls the IONIX API and writes data to the CyberpionActionItems_CL table.**

sampleQueries.description: All open high urgency action items
sampleQueries.query:
CyberpionActionItems_CL
| where is_open_b == true and urgency_d >= 9
| project TimeGenerated, host_s, Category, urgency_d, summary_s

CyberpionActionItems_CL
| where is_open_b == true
| summarize count() by Category

dataTypes.name: CyberpionActionItems_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CyberpionActionItems_CL
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

customs.name: IONIX API Token
customs.description: An API token from IONIX Portal is required. Create one in **Settings > API** in your [IONIX Portal](https://portal.ionix.io/).

instructionSteps.title: Connect IONIX to Microsoft Sentinel
instructionSteps.description:
This connector uses the IONIX API to automatically poll for action items and ingest them into Microsoft Sentinel. You need an API token from your IONIX Portal.
>

parameters.label: IONIX API Token
parameters.placeholder: Enter your JWT API token from IONIX Settings > API
parameters.name: apiToken

dataFlows.transformKql: source | extend id_s = tostring(['id']) | extend host_s = tostring(['asset']) | extend Category = tostring(['type']) | extend urgency_d = todouble(['urgency']['urgency']) | extend opening_datetime_t = todatetime(['first_opened_at']) | extend solution_s = tostring(['type']) | extend current_state_s = tostring(['current_state']) | extend title_s = tostring(['title']['label']) | extend summary_s = tostring(['summary']) | extend description_s = tostring(['description']) | project TimeGenerated, id_s, host_s, Category, urgency_d, opening_datetime_t, solution_s, current_state_s, title_s, summary_s, description_s

properties.description: HighUrgencyActionItems_AnalyticalRules Analytics Rule with template version 3.0.0

This query creates an alert for active IONIX Action Items with high urgency (9-10).
 Urgency can be altered using the "min_urgency" variable in the query.
properties.query:
let timeframe = 14d;
let min_urgency = 9;
CyberpionActionItems_CL
 | where TimeGenerated > ago(timeframe)
 | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by id_s
 | where is_open_b == true
 | where urgency_d >= min_urgency
 | extend timestamp = opening_datetime_t
 | extend DNSCustomEntity = host_s

properties.descriptionHtml:
Note: There may be known issues pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing.

The IONIX solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest vulnerability logs from the IONIX platform into Microsoft Sentinel.

Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:

This solution is dependent on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in Preview state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs:

  1. Codeless Connector Platform/Native Sentinel Polling

Data Connectors: 2, Workbooks: 1, Analytic Rules: 1

Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel | Learn more about Solutions
